text:
I came to my A level choices completely on the basis of my own wish. During my time in High school I have always enjoyed English Literature, Sciences and Math, however I found Mathematics always challenging but enjoyable at the same time hence chose Mathematics as an A level after getting a B at GCSE level.

I found about ACCA on the basis of my own research. 

School is going good, before i started year 12 my head of maths teacher told me i could not do A level mathematics because obtaining a B at GCSE level maths was not good enough for A level hence advised me to change the subject.

However I really wanted to do A level Mathematics hence arrived at the decision to do in independently, on my own behalf hence convinced my head of sixth form to permit me to do 2 A levels (English and Biology) and Math was the subject i will do independently.

By the time Year 12 exams arrived, I managed to get a B for my AS mathematics and obtained two Ds for my other subjects I did at school. Which I think is pretty funny. 

I am now in Year 13 doing my last year of A levels and have practice exams in a week. The preparation for it is ongoing and will let you know of the results once theyre completed. 
:blush: :blush:
I would like to know more about the world of finance and what it is like to be working in such a developing industry and what are future prospects like for ACCA accountants?
